news_header: Human-caused climate change has intensified the deadliest extreme weather events in the last 20 years, leading to over 570,000 deaths.
news_text: A new analysis reveals that climate change has made the ten deadliest extreme weather events of the past two decades more intense and likely, resulting in over 570,000 fatalities across Europe, Africa, and Asia. The study, conducted by scientists from the World Weather Attribution group, indicates that events like the 2011 drought in Somalia and heatwaves in France and Europe were exacerbated by climate change. Researchers emphasize the urgent need for political leaders to address fossil fuel dependence to mitigate future suffering.
